description:
A character with red colored eyes.
Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as the lighting on the characters), there is an overlap between this tag and the orange eyes and brown eyes tags.
merge_instruction:
red eyes can be merged with:

Other eye colors
Merge with other eye color tags such as blue eyes, black eyes, white eyes, yellow eyes to form compound tags like red-blue eyes, red-white eyes, red-black gradient eyes
Do not merge with multicolored eyes or rainbow eyes

Examples:
red eyes, blue eyes -> red-blue eyes
red eyes, black eyes, gradient eyes -> red-black gradient eyes
red eyes, yellow eyes, heterochromia -> red-yellow heterochromia eyes

Iris form tags
Merge with iris shape tags such as ringed eyes, dashed eyes, squiggle eyes, pac-man eyes to form tags like red ringed eyes exept @ @ tag
Examples:
red eyes, ringed eyes -> red ringed eyes
red eyes, pac-man eyes -> red pac-man eyes
red eyes, @ @-> red eyes, @ @
red eyes, mismatched irises, white iris->red eyes with white mismatched irises

Pupil color tags
Merge in the form red eyes with [pupil color] pupils

Examples:
red eyes, aqua pupils -> red eyes with aqua pupils
red eyes, white pupils -> red eyes with white pupils
red eyes, brown pupils -> red eyes with brown pupils
red eyes, dilated pupils, orange pupils -> red eyes with orange dilated pupils

Pupil shape tags
Merge in the form red eyes with [pupil shape] pupils

red eyes, slit pupils -> red eyes with slit pupils
red eyes, diamond-shaped pupils, red eyes with diamond-shaped pupils
red eyes, star-shaped pupils, white pupils-> red eyes with white star-shaped pupils

description: A character with rainbow colored eyes.
merge_instruction:
rainbow eyes merging rules

General notes

    Do not merge rainbow eyes with other standard eye color tags (such as red eyes, blue eyes, green eyes, etc.) into compound color tags (e.g., red-rainbow eyes is invalid)

    Rainbow eyes are considered a self-contained multi-color style and should be kept as a unique color descriptor

    Can be merged with form, pupil, sclera, stylistic, or inhuman eye tags

    If multiple eye tags are present, preserve rainbow eyes as its own entity or assign it to specific eyes when clearly indicated (e.g., rainbow third eye)

Iris form tags
Merge in the form: rainbow [iris form] eyes

Examples:
rainbow eyes, ringed eyes → rainbow ringed eyes
rainbow eyes, squiggle eyes → rainbow squiggle eyes
rainbow eyes, pac-man eyes → rainbow pac-man eyes
rainbow eyes, dashed eyes → rainbow dashed eyes
rainbow eyes, mismatched irises, white iris → rainbow eyes with white mismatched irises

Pupil color tags
Merge in the form: rainbow eyes with [pupil color] pupils

Examples:
rainbow eyes, aqua pupils → rainbow eyes with aqua pupils
rainbow eyes, red pupils → rainbow eyes with red pupils
rainbow eyes, glowing pupils → rainbow eyes with glowing pupils

Pupil shape tags
Merge in the form: rainbow eyes with [pupil shape] pupils

Examples:
rainbow eyes, slit pupils → rainbow eyes with slit pupils
rainbow eyes, star-shaped pupils → rainbow eyes with star-shaped pupils
rainbow eyes, x-shaped pupils, white pupils → rainbow eyes with white x-shaped pupils
rainbow eyes, constricted pupils → rainbow eyes with constricted pupils

Sclera color tags
Merge in the form: rainbow eyes with [sclera color] sclera

Examples:
rainbow eyes, black sclera → rainbow eyes with black sclera
rainbow eyes, white sclera → rainbow eyes with white sclera
rainbow eyes, mismatched sclera, blue sclera, pink sclera → rainbow eyes with blue-pink sclera

glowing eyes / flaming eyes tags
Merge to: rainbow glowing eyes, rainbow flaming eyes

Examples:
rainbow eyes, glowing eyes → rainbow glowing eyes
rainbow eyes, flaming eyes → rainbow flaming eyes

animal / inhuman / artificial eyes
Merge directly to form tags like rainbow pixel eyes, rainbow button eyes

Examples:
rainbow eyes, button eyes → rainbow button eyes
rainbow eyes, lens eye → rainbow lens eyes
rainbow eyes, compound eyes → rainbow compound eyes

stylistic eyes
Merge to: rainbow [style] eyes

Examples:
rainbow eyes, jitome → rainbow jitome eyes
rainbow eyes, tsurime → rainbow tsurime eyes
rainbow eyes, spiral-only eyes → rainbow spiral-only eyes
rainbow eyes, sparkling eyes → rainbow sparkling eyes

third eye / extra eyes

    Assign rainbow eyes based on position or number if possible

    Do not merge rainbow with other color tags

    When used as a third eye: → [color] eyes, rainbow third eye

    When extra: → rainbow extra eyes

Examples:
rainbow eyes, third eye, red eyes → red eyes, rainbow third eye
extra eyes, rainbow eyes → rainbow extra eyes
extra eyes, blue eyes, rainbow eyes → blue extra eyes, rainbow eyes

Do not merge rainbow eyes with other eye color tags in compound forms. Always preserve "rainbow eyes" as a single descriptor.

description:
Form of the iris.
Eyes with a spiral or swirling pattern used to represent embarrassment, confusion, dizziness, hypnosis, overwhelm, or loss of consciousness.
Less commonly, may indicate a character who is drunk or angry.
Also applies when the character’s iris is naturally swirled or spiraled in design.
If the swirling pattern appears on glasses (usually to indicate a goofy, nerdy, or genius character), use coke-bottle glasses instead.
Do not confuse with:
spiral eyes – when the entire eye is a spiral with no visible sclera.
ringed eyes – when there are rings in the iris but no swirling motion.

description:
Form of the iris
Ringed eyes are eyes in which the pupil and/or iris are surrounded by one or more concentric circles or rings. These rings are typically centered around the pupil and can vary in number, thickness, and intensity. They may appear as full circles, dotted arcs, or partial curves above or below the pupil.
This design is often used to create a surreal, hypnotic, or emotionally intense effect, and may overlap stylistically with glowing, patterned, or stylized eye tags.
Not to be confused with:
@ @ – used for swirling eyes, not ring patterns.
spiral-only eyes – when the entire eye has a spiral shape instead of concentric rings.
This tag is often missing in prompts. If a prompt suggests other eye tags, manually check the image: if the eyes are ringed, add or merge this tag.

Pupil color is often missing in prompts. If eye color tags are present, check the image for the actual pupil color. A pupil is a distinct, typically circular area in the center of the eye, clearly separated from the surrounding iris or sclera.
It usually appears as a solid-colored or dark spot with a clear border.

If the eye lacks such a distinct center, or if the entire eye appears uniformly colored with no internal separation, then the image likely depicts no visible pupil.
In such cases, the correct tag is no pupils. Add the appropriate pupil tag to the prompt, or merge it with existing eye tags if possible. Pupils color is not a tag, do not add this as tag, use tags presented from above.
